title: Nepal protests live: Nepali Congress office, top leaders’ homes set on fire
summary: Protesters set fire to homes of some top political leaders, a day after 19 people were killed by the security forces.

title: Palestinians on edge as Israel ramps up raids in wake of Jerusalem attack
summary: Israeli forces storm towns, villages and carry out arrests in occupied West Bank after a deadly shooting on Monday.

title: Australian PM says Vanuatu security, climate agreement delayed
summary: PM Anthony Albanese says he won't sign Nakamal Agreement in Vanuatu, despite recent high-level talks on the pact.

title: ICC opens war crimes hearing against Ugandan rebel Joseph Kony
summary: Kony faces charges for the Lord's Resistance Army campaign of torture and abuse in Uganda in the early 2000s.

title: Global Sumud Flotilla reports drone attack on Gaza-bound ship in Tunisia
summary: Tunisian authorities find no evidence of a hostile act and say the fire originated inside the Family Boat.

title: Hundreds of earthquake-hit villages in Afghanistan still not reached: UN
summary: The UN says the affected areas were already some of the most remote in the country, leaving communities cut off.

title: Moment of suspected drone attack on Global Sumud Flotilla boat
summary: Activists from the Global Sumud Fotilla to Gaza say one of their boats was struck by a drone at a port in Tunisia.

title: Indonesian President Prabowo replaces five ministers after deadly protests
summary: Finance Minister Sri Mulyani Indrawati was among those ousted days after protesters raided her home.

title: LIVE: Israel pounds Gaza City as Netanyahu tells residents to ‘leave now’
summary: Israeli forces bomb more high-rise buildings in Gaza City as Netanyahu warns residents to flee.

title: South Korea to send plane for workers detained in US immigration raid
summary: Flagship carrier Korean Air says plane could depart for Atlanta, Georgia, as soon as Wednesday.

title: Thai court says ex-premier Thaksin Shinawatra must serve year in prison
summary: Thailand's Supreme Court ruled that hospital stay does not count as time served for the ex-prime minister.

title: North Korea’s Kim heralds new ICBM rocket engine test as ‘significant’
summary: Kim supervised test of new solid-fuel rocket engine for N Korea's ICBMs, in latest development of his missile arsenal.

title: Syria condemns attacks by Israeli warplanes on cities of Homs and Latakia
summary: Latest Israeli attacks are a continuation of Israel's 'aggressive escalations', says Syrian Foreign Ministry.

title: Rupert Murdoch seals deal passing control of media empire to eldest son
summary: Legal settlement ensures Lachlan Murdoch will take control of sprawling media portfolio after 94-year-old mogul's death.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,293
summary: Here are the key events on day 1,293 of Russia’s war on Ukraine.

title: La flottille pour Gaza dit avoir été "frappée" par un drone au large de Tunis, la Tunisie dément
summary: La flottille en route vers Gaza pour acheminer de l'aide humanitaire a affirmé, dans la nuit de lundi à mardi, qu'un de ses bateaux a été touché par un drone au large de Tunis. L'équipage fait état de dégâts matériels et dénonce "des actes d'agression visant à faire dérailler (sa) mission". La Tunisie, elle, assure n'avoir détecté aucun appareil.

title: Tunisie : accueillie par une foule à Tunis, la flottille met le cap sur Gaza
summary: Plus d'un millier de personnes, parmi lesquelles l'eurodéputée Rima Hassan, ont accueilli dimanche à Tunis la flottille partie de Barcelone avec à son bord des militants et de l'aide humanitaire pour Gaza. La flottille partira mercredi 10 septembre, avec l'objectif "d'ouvrir un corridor humanitaire et de mettre fin au génocide en cours du peuple palestinien", selon les organisateurs.

title: Jérusalem : au moins cinq morts dans une fusillade
summary: Au moins cinq personnes ont été tuées et plusieurs autres ont été blessées lundi, dans une attaque à l'arme à feu à Jérusalem-Est. Cette attaque est l'une des plus meurtrières dans la ville depuis le début de la guerre à Gaza en octobre 2023.

title: L'Espagne veut "mettre fin au génocide à Gaza", Israël dénonce une "campagne antisémite"
summary: Israël a accusé lundi l'Espagne de mener une "campagne antisémite", après l'annonce par le Premier ministre espagnol, Pedro Sanchez, d'une série de mesures destinées à mettre fin à ce qu'il a qualifié de "génocide à Gaza". Madrid a rejeté dans la foulée des "accusations fausses et calomnieuses" et rappelé son ambassadrice à Tel-Aviv.

title: Barzani : "Aucun doute que l'EI réapparaisse en Irak après le retrait des États-Unis"
summary: Dans un entretien accordé à France 24, le président du Parti démocratique du Kurdistan, Massoud Barzani, revient sur la situation des minorités kurdes en Syrie, ainsi que sur le désarmement annoncé du PKK en Turquie, et sur le retrait d'Irak des troupes de la coalition dirigée par les Etats-Unis, prévu en fin d'année.

title: Un attentat à Jérusalem-Est fait au moins six morts, les deux assaillants palestiniens tués
summary: Deux Palestiniens ont ouvert le feu lundi sur une station de bus à Jérusalem-Est, tuant six personnes. Les deux assaillants ont été abattus, selon la police.

title: Un accord à Gaza : Trump lance un avertissement au Hamas
summary: Donald Trump a écrit dimanche : "Les Israéliens ont accepté mes conditions. Il est temps pour le Hamas d'accepter également. Ceci est mon dernier avertissement." Washington aurait communiqué une nouvelle proposition au Hamas, comme "une relance des pourparlers", estime le correspondant de France 24 à Washington, Matthieu Mabin. "Le Hamas se dit prêt à négocier, selon nos sources ua département américain."

title: Donald Trump envoie un "dernier avertissement" au Hamas, qui se dit prêt à négocier
summary: Le président américain Donald Trump a lancé dimanche un "dernier avertissement" au Hamas, exhortant le groupe islamiste à accepter un accord pour libérer les otages encore détenus dans la bande de Gaza. De son côté, le Hamas s'est dit disposé à reprendre "immédiatement" les négociations.

title: Israël intensifie ses opérations à Gaza avec la destruction d’une nouvelle tour d'habitation
summary: L’armée israélienne a bombardé, dimanche, la tour Al-Rouya à Gaza-ville, détruisant l’immeuble et tuant une personne, selon la Défense civile de la bande de Gaza. Cette frappe survient alors que Benjamin Netanyahu a annoncé l’extension des opérations militaires dans la ville.

title: Israël menace ceux qui reconnaîtront la Palestine d'une riposte "unilatérale"
summary: Le ministre israélien des Affaires étrangères, Gideon Saar, a déclaré, dimanche, que la reconnaissance d’un État palestinien pousserait Israël à adopter des actions unilatérales. Cette mise en garde survient alors que plusieurs pays occidentaux, dont la France, ont annoncé leur intention de reconnaître la Palestine d’ici fin septembre à l’ONU.

title: Israël : nouvelle manifestation pour réclamer la fin du conflit et la libération de tous les otages
summary: Des manifestations ont eu lieu à Tel-Aviv et à Jérusalem, samedi soir, pour demander la libération des otages et la fin de la guerre à Gaza. Alors que l'armée israélienne a ciblé, samedi, une nouvelle tour d'immeuble à Gaza-ville et appelé les habitants de Gaza à évacuer.

title: À Gaza, l’armée israélienne dirige les déplacés vers des zones dangereuses ou déjà occupées
summary: L’armée israélienne incite les habitants de la ville de Gaza à évacuer vers de prétendues "vastes zones vides" du sud de l’enclave. Nombre de ces zones – où de nouvelles tentes sont apparues ces derniers jours – sont pourtant déjà largement occupées ou se situent dans un périmètre jugé dangereux par l’armée. Sur place, nos Observateurs racontent la difficulté à trouver un endroit où s'installer.

title: Israël : la contestation monte, les opérations à Gaza se poursuivent
summary: En Israël, les manifestations se multiplient pour réclamer la libération des otages et dénoncer la stratégie du Premier ministre Benjamin Netanyahu. Malgré une contestation croissante au sein de l'opinion publique, les opérations militaires à Gaza continuent. Les précisions de Noga Tarnopolsky, correspondante de France 24 à Jérusalem.

title: À Gaza-ville, la peur des habitants après l'annonce de nouvelles frappes
summary: L'armée israélienne a frappé vendredi 6 septembre une tour d'immeuble dans la ville de Gaza, qu'Israël menace d'une offensive militaire majeure. Selon Rami Abou Jammous, journaliste indépendant à Gaza-ville, la peur grandit chez les habitants. "J'habite à 500-600 mètres de la tour touchée et on sait que ça va bientôt être notre tour. On prépare nos valises, mais on ne sait pas où aller. Tous nos souvenirs peuvent disparaître en trois secondes", témoigne-t-il sur notre antenne.

title: De l’aide humanitaire non livrée à Gaza ? Les ONG contestent
summary: Des influenceurs pro-israéliens affirment que l’aide humanitaire s’entasse et pourrit au point de passage de Kerem Shalom parce que les ONG et l’ONU ne la livrent pas. Une version contestée par les organisations internationales.

title: En Roumanie, une rentrée sociale tendue sur fond de politique d’austérité
summary: Des milliers d’enseignants et d’étudiants ont manifesté, lundi, à Bucarest, contre les mesures mises en place cet été par le gouvernement du libéral Ilie Bolojan pour réduire le déficit budgétaire, le plus haut de l’Union européenne.

title: Au Niger, le directeur d’un hebdomadaire arrêté pour « diffamation » envers le premier ministre
summary: Fin août, « Le Courrier » avait cité le nom d’Ali Mahamane Lamine Zeine dans un article sur une affaire de « fraude de cigarettes » impliquant plusieurs personnalités.

title: Thaïlande : la Cour suprême ordonne l’emprisonnement immédiat pour corruption de l’ex-premier ministre, Thaksin Shinawatra
summary: Condamné à huit ans d’emprisonnement pour corruption, l’homme politique le plus influent du pays n’avait passé que six mois en détention, à l’hôpital, après son retour d’exil, en 2023.

title: Gaza : l’Espagne durcit sa position sur Israël en promettant un embargo sur les armes et de l’aide humanitaire
summary: Le premier ministre, Pedro Sanchez, a présenté, lundi, un ensemble de décisions « pour mettre fin au génocide à Gaza ».

title: En direct, guerre en Ukraine : les dernières informations
summary: « Les Russes concentrent de nouveau leurs attaques contre notre secteur énergétique », affirme Volodymyr Zelensky. Les Ukrainiens doivent se préparer à d’éventuelles coupures de courant pendant l’automne et l’hiver, ont averti les autorités.

title: Exosens, un fabricant de jumelles de vision nocturne en plein essor
summary: Cinq ans après le veto de l’Etat contre son rachat américain, la société fait figure de « totem » de la souveraineté industrielle de défense et augmente les capacités de son usine de Brive, en Corrèze.

title: En direct, Gaza : l’armée israélienne dit qu’elle va agir avec une « puissance accrue » dans la ville de Gaza
summary: L’armée israélienne a déjà publié de nombreux ordres d’évacuation à destination des Gazaouis depuis ces derniers jours, tout en intensifiant ses frappes sur la ville.

title: Canicule : le mois d’août 2025, le troisième plus chaud jamais mesuré, selon l’observatoire européen Copernicus
summary: La température moyenne à la surface des terres et des océans a été supérieure de 1,29 °C à celle de l’ère préindustrielle. Les deux mois d’août les plus chauds jamais connus restent ceux de 2023 et de 2024.

title: Ursula von der Leyen, visage de la faiblesse de l’Union européenne
summary: La présidente de la Commission européenne prononcera au Parlement européen son discours annuel sur l’état de l’Union, mercredi 10 septembre. Elle concentre les critiques portées contre l’accord commercial avec les Etats-Unis de Donald Trump.

title: Gaza : des opérateurs civils de bulldozers recrutés par l’armée israélienne pour « démolir » les maisons et bâtiments
summary: Les militaires considèrent chaque bâtiment de l’enclave comme une menace pouvant abriter des explosifs ou des tireurs. Des dizaines d’annonces postées en ligne suggèrent que les seuls engins conduits par l’armée ne suffisent plus à les détruire.

title: Israël promet une riposte d’ampleur en Cisjordanie après une attaque à Jérusalem-Est
summary: Un attentat a fait six morts à Jérusalem-Est, lundi. A quelques semaines de la reconnaissance de l’Etat de Palestine par la France, l’Australie ou le Canada, Benyamin Nétanyahou réfléchit à déclarer sa souveraineté sur tout ou partie de ce territoire, qu’il a défini comme « un des sept fronts » avec notamment le Hamas, le Hezbollah et l’Iran.

title: Janet Mills, la gouverneure du Maine qui s’oppose à Donald Trump au nom du droit
summary: « L’Amérique des “résistantes” » (2/5). En février, l’élue démocrate est passée à la postérité en tenant tête au président américain. Sept mois plus tard, cette éminente juriste continue à se battre sur tous les fronts juridiques.

title: En Inde, la bonne fortune américaine du mégatemple Hare Krishna
summary: A Mayapur, le monument érigé à la gloire de Krishna par ses adeptes pourrait devenir d’ici à 2027 le plus grand bâtiment religieux du monde. Ce projet faramineux, débuté en 2010, a été largement financé par Alfred Ford, l’arrière-petit-fils du constructeur automobile.

title: Guillaume Devin, politiste : « Il n’y a pas de risque de désintégration du système international »
summary: A l’occasion de l’ouverture de la 80ᵉ Assemblée générale des Nations unies, le spécialiste du multilatéralisme estime, dans un entretien au « Monde », que le « système international » peut résister aux crises mondiales actuelles grâce à ses multiples dimensions.

title: La police de l’immigration envoyée à Chicago pour cibler « les pires des pires immigrés illégaux criminels », selon l’administration Trump
summary: L’administration Trump reproche aux autorités démocrates de l’Illinois d’avoir remis en liberté des personnes ayant commis de multiples crimes.

title: Israel to revoke work permits of Palestinians from the town of two Jerusalem attackers
summary:
Israel to revoke work permits of Palestinians from the town of two Jerusalem attackers

Israel has ordered work and entry permits revoked for the relatives of two Jerusalem attackers, as well as residents of their hometowns of Qatanna and Qubeiba in Ramallah in the occupied West Bank, according to The Times of Israel.

Defence Minister Israel Katz said 750 permits to Israel will be revoked.

title: Israeli attacks kill 11 Palestinians since dawn
summary:
Israeli attacks kill 11 Palestinians since dawn

At least 11 people have been killed in Israeli air strikes across Gaza since dawn today, according to Al Jazeera.

More than 20 people are missing following the strikes, the network said.

title: Report: Israel hits vehicle in Lebanon
summary:
Report: Israel hits vehicle in Lebanon

The Israeli drone struck a vehicle in the Iqlim al-Kharroub region of Lebanon, Lebanon’s National News Agency reported.

No casualties were reported.

title: Sumud Flotilla publishes footage showing its boat struck from above
summary:
Sumud Flotilla publishes footage showing its boat struck from above

The Global Sumud Flotilla for Gaza publishes video footage on X that shows the moment that one of its main boats was struck from above in Tunisian waters.

The footage came after the Tunisian authorities said the explosion originated inside the vessel.

“Acts of aggression aimed at intimidating and derailing our mission will not deter us. Our peaceful mission to break the siege on Gaza and stand in solidarity with its people continues with determination and resolve,” the group said in a separate post on Instagram.

Footage from another boat of our Flotilla shows the exact moment the Family Boat was struck from above. pic.twitter.com/qVpUyg56uP

— Global Sumud Flotilla (@GlobalSumudFlot) September 9, 2025

title: Israeli military issues sweeping forced evacuation notice to all Gaza City residents
summary:
Israeli military issues sweeping forced evacuation notice to all Gaza City residents

The Israeli military ordered all of Gaza City residents to evacuate "from the Old City and Tuffah in the east to the sea in the west" towards a so-called humanitarian zone in al-Mawasi ahead of a ground invasion.

Hamas previously rejected the Israeli claim that there is a humanitarian zone in the area.

The announcement marks the first sweeping forced evacuation order for all of Gaza City.

title: Morning update
summary:
Morning update

Good morning Middle East Eye readers,

Here are the latest developments on Israel's ongoing genocide in Gaza and developments from the Occupied West Bank and the region:

  • The Global Sumud Flotilla for Gaza said on Tuesday that one of its main boats was struck by a drone in Tunisian waters. Tunisian authorities said the explosion originated inside the vessel.

  • Israel struck in the vicinity of Syria's central Homs city, the coastal city of Latakia, and the historic city of Palmyra, Syrian media said on Monday.

  • A major arms fair opens Tuesday in London without the presence of Israeli government officials due to worsening diplomatic relations between Britain and Israel.

  • Britain's Prime Minister Keir Starmer met with Palestinian Authority president Mahmud Abbas Monday in London, as the UK government edges towards recognising a Palestinian state.

  • The Palestinian health ministry said Monday that the Israeli military killed two teenagers in Jenin refugee camp, in the northern West Bank.

title: Evening recap
summary:
Evening recap

Good evening Middle East Eye readers, 

At least 52 Palestinians were killed by Israeli strikes on Gaza. Israel also launched strikes on the Peace Tower in Gaza City as it escalates its efforts to destroy civilian infrastructure. 

Here is what else you need to know: 

  • The Trump administration gave Hamas an unmarked and unsigned, five-point summary outlining US President Donald Trump’s proposal for a Gaza ceasefire over the weekend, according to Drop Site News
  • The Israeli army said that four soldiers were killed in combat in the northern Gaza Strip on Monday
  • US President Donald Trump's son-in-law and former Middle East advisor met on Monday with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's top adviser, Ron Dermer, in Miami
  • The main ship in the Gaza Freedom Flotilla appears to have been targeted by an Israeli drone, according to Al Jazeera Arabic

title: Gaza Sumud Flotilla ship targeted by drone: Report
summary:
Gaza Sumud Flotilla ship targeted by drone: Report

The main ship in the Gaza Sumud Flotilla appears to have been targeted by a drone, according to Al Jazeera Arabic. 

The strike happened off the coast of Tunisia, according to the report.

title: Israeli settler attacks against Palestinians spread across occupied West Bank
summary:
Israeli settler attacks against Palestinians spread across occupied West Bank

Israeli settler attacks against Palestinians escalated across the occupied West Bank on Monday evening. 

Israeli settlers attacked Palestinian vehicles northeast of Ramallah, Wafa news site reported.

Meanwhile, a group of settlers set fire to a nursery in the village of Deir Sharaf, near Nablus.

The attacks come as Israeli leaders have vowed retaliation in the wake of a deadly shooting in Jerusalem that left six dead on Monday.

title: US Supreme Court rules immigration agents can now racially profile people
summary:
US Supreme Court rules immigration agents can now racially profile people

Submitted by MEE staff on Mon, 09/08/2025 - 21:02
Ruling means that people who look foreign, speak Spanish or English with an accent can be detained in Los Angeles area
Demonstrators gather in front of city hall during a 'No Kings' protest following federal immigration raids in Los Angeles, California, on 4 July 2025 (Etienne Laurent/AFP)
Off

Immigration officials will now be able to profile people in Los Angeles, California, based on their skin colour, accent and the language they speak, according to a US Supreme Court ruling on Monday.

The decision overrides a temporary restraining order by a Los Angeles judge that banned federal agencies, including the Department of Homeland Security, from having “roving patrols” which can detain people without reasonable suspicion based solely on their apparent race or ethnicity; speaking Spanish or English with an accent; presence in a particular location like a bus stop, car wash, or agricultural site or the type of work a person does.

In the 6-3 ruling, Justice Brett M Kavanaugh wrote a 10-page opinion to explain the decision, saying illegal immigration “is especially pronounced” in the Los Angeles area.

“About 10 percent of the people in the Los Angeles region are illegally in the United States - meaning about 2 million illegal immigrants out of a total population of 20 million,” he wrote.

He said that “immigration officers ‘may briefly detain’ an individual ‘for questioning’ if they have ‘a reasonable suspicion, based on specific articulable facts, that the person being questioned ... is an alien illegally in the United States.’”

He said such stops are reasonable and legal based on the “totality of the circumstances”.

Justice Sonia Sotomayor, who dissented, called the decision “another grave misuse" of our emergency docket.

“We should not have to live in a country where the Government can seize anyone who looks Latino, speaks Spanish, and appears to work a low-wage job. Rather than stand idly by while our constitutional freedoms are lost, I dissent”.

Lawyers at the American Civil Liberties Union of Southern California slammed the decision.

Police make 630 arrests in Washington as Trump federal takeover ramps up
Read More »

“This decision is a devastating setback for our plaintiffs and communities who, for months, have been subjected to immigration stops because of the color of their skin, occupation, or the language they speak,” said senior staff attorney Mohammad Tajsar in a public statement.

“In running to the Supreme Court to request this stay, the government made clear that its enforcement operation in Southern California is driven by race."

The statement continues with a promise to continue "fighting" the "racist" scheme. 

"We will continue fighting the administration’s racist deportation scheme to ensure every person living in Southern California - regardless of race or status - is safe.”

The case is ongoing in lower courts and could again be appealed to the highest court.

In early June, the Trump administration launched immigration raids across Los Angeles and surrounding counties. During the raids, teams of armed and masked agents pulled up to locations such as car washes, farms and parks and began seizing individuals on sight, often before asking a single question.

The raids are part of the Trump administration’s agenda to deport hundreds of thousands of undocumented migrants.

Many legal immigrants have also been detained in the raids.

US Politics

title: Holocaust Museum LA deletes post saying 'never again' applies to all people
summary:
Holocaust Museum LA deletes post saying 'never again' applies to all people

Submitted by MEE staff on Mon, 09/08/2025 - 20:25
The institution later said it never intended to get 'political'
Former California Governor Arnold Schwarzenegger accepts 'Award of Courage' during the Los Angeles Holocaust Museum's 15th annual gala at the Beverly Hills Hotel in Los Angeles, California, on 6 November 2023 (David Swanson/AFP)
Off

The Holocaust Museum LA on Saturday deleted a social media post stating in block letters that "'Never again' can't only mean never again for Jews," on an illustrated image of interlocking human arms of different shades. 

"Standing with humanity does not betray our people," the following slide said. "It honours them."

Within a day, the post was gone, and they promised to "do better".

“We recently posted an item on social media that was part of a pre-planned campaign intended to promote inclusivity and community that was easily open to misinterpretation by some to be a political statement reflecting the ongoing situation in the Middle East. That was not our intent,” a later post said.

"It has been removed to avoid any further confusion," the museum added. "We promise to do better". 

A screenshot of the original image released by the California museum was captured by Ryan Grim, co-founder of Dropsite News. 

"Speechless. No words for this," he captioned in a post on X.

"Think about how many people must have complained about this first message to get them to delete it and even issue an apology," he wrote. "If you denounce genocide, some might think you’re being critical of Israel and we can’t have that". 

The Forward news outlet, which targets a Jewish American audience, noted that Jews who have rallied against gun violence in the US and against China's crackdown on the Uyghur minority have used the phrase "never again" for their causes, but others oppose it for anything but the Holocaust of World War II. 

Israel's nearly two-year-long genocide in Gaza has resulted in images of crowded, unsanitary camps, starvation, and mass graves that mirror the photographs displayed in museums around the world erected to remember the Holocaust. Israeli historians, scholars, and human rights organisations have called the war in Gaza a genocide, with over 64,000 killed, 160,000 injured and starvation looming over the enclave. 

In the West, it is a crime to deny one Holocaust and dangerous to name another
Read More »

The former United Nations aid chief, Martin Griffiths, has said he is convinced that Israel's assault on Gaza is the "worst crime of the 21st century". 

But pro-Israel voices, including hardline American Evangelical Christians, have been adamant that Palestinians not be included in mentions of genocide.

"In many of the same states that have criminalised Holocaust denial, it is opposition to, rather than open denial of, the Gaza Genocide that is criminalised and punished," political analyst Mouin Rabbani wrote in an opinion for Middle East Eye.

"People have been fired from jobs, lost business, forfeited careers and educational opportunities, and literally been imprisoned for speaking out against it". 

Historian and media critic Assal Rad said Palestinians are "so dehumanised" to the point that they cannot be included in universal anti-genocide messaging. 

"All this killing over the past 700 days - the photos of starving children, civilians torn to pieces, and the world’s first live-streamed genocide - yet the LA Holocaust Museum described it as an 'ongoing situation in the Middle East,'" writer Reem al-Harmi said. "This is next-level gaslighting". 

The Holocaust Museum LA is currently closed until June 2026 for renovations. 

Israel's genocide in Gaza

title: Kushner meets Netanyahu advisor in Miami: Report
summary:
Kushner meets Netanyahu advisor in Miami: Report

US President Donald Trump's son-in-law and former Middle East advisor met on Monday with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's top adviser, Ron Dermer, in Miami to discuss a ceasefire and post-war Gaza, according to Axios. 

Kushner previously attended a post-war Gaza meeting with former UK Prime Minister Tony Blair at the White House, media reports said. 

Kushner floated plans for a "Gaza Riviera" before Trump announced the plan earlier this year.

title: Mamdani says he will keep New York City pension fund out of Israel Bonds
summary:
Mamdani says he will keep New York City pension fund out of Israel Bonds

Submitted by MEE staff on Mon, 09/08/2025 - 17:50
Mamdani said the city needs to find out where its investments are 'directly implicated' in violations of international law
New York City mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani speaks during 'Fighting Oligarchy: A Town Hall on Making New York City Affordable' at Brooklyn College in NYC, on 6 September 2025 (Angela Weiss/AFP)
Off

New York City’s Democratic nominee for mayor, Zohran Mamdani, said in a television interview on Sunday that he does not believe the city’s pension funds should be invested in Israel Bonds because of the country's violations of international law. 

During an interview on CBS New York’s The Point with Marcia Kramer, Kramer asked Mamdani if he would ask those who are in charge of the city’s pensions to divest from companies doing business with Israel or from Israel Bonds. NYC has historically had sizeable investments in both.

“I think that we should not have a fund that is invested in the violation of international law,” Mamdani told Kramer.

He went on to say that current NYC comptroller Brad Lander had taken the “right approach” with regard to Israeli bonds.

“I think that the current comptroller’s approach as he has taken it with Israel Bonds is the right approach,” he added.

Kramer persisted in asking Mamdani about his position on divesting from other companies that do business with Israel.

“And what about the other companies?” she said. “The companies that do business with Israel? BDS”.

Mamdani avoided addressing the question directly, instead saying that it was important to understand where the city was “directly implicated”.

“I think the most important thing is to figure out where we are directly implicated, and in the city pension fund, purchasing Israel Bonds, that to me, is something that is a clear indication of our values, and we know that our values are actually with international law,” he said.

As of March last year, the New York State Common Retirement Fund held about $352m in Israel Bonds. It is one of the top US-based investors in the bonds.

Mamdani also told Kramer he had repeatedly said over the course of his primary campaign that he believes wherever the current administration violates international law through its policies, it should return to compliance.

Already out

NYC’s pension funds comprise five funds, including the New York Employees' Retirement System, the New York City Fire Pension Fund, the New York City Police Pension Fund, the New York City Teachers' Retirement System, and the New York City Board of Education Retirement System.

Zohran Mamdani's support for Palestinian rights sealed mayoral primary win, poll shows
Read More »

The city’s pension funds' total assets are worth $289bn and are overseen by the city’s comptroller.

NYC had a 50-year record of pension funds investing in Israel Bonds until 2023, when current comptroller Lander changed course.

Lander, who took office in 2022, decided not to purchase new Israel Bonds when $30m of the bonds matured in early 2023, citing a city policy of avoiding foreign sovereign debt and a desire not to give Israel preferential treatment over other countries in the pension portfolio.

After Lander’s revelation in July, his decision sparked controversy and backlash, with accusations that he had capitulated to the Palestinian-led Boycott, Divestment and Sanctions movement. Lander maintains his decision was not political.

NYC’s pension fund continues to have $315m invested in Israeli firms and real estate.

Meanwhile, Mamdani continued making waves over the weekend after joining Vermont Senator Bernie Sanders at a town hall in the borough of Brooklyn on Saturday, with an estimated 1,700 people in attendance.

The event, which was held at Sanders’ alma mater, Brooklyn College, was part of Sanders’ "Fighting Oligarchy" tour.

The night focused on wrestling back economic and political power from corporate and "oligarchic" interests.

While Mamdani has come under criticism for sounding more centrist in recent weeks, he returned to his grassroots positions by condemning the City University of New York’s decision to fire four professors for their pro-Palestine views in his opening speech at the event with Sanders. 

US Politics

title: Valerie Zink: Why I quit and cut up my Reuters press card over Gaza
summary:
Valerie Zink: Why I quit and cut up my Reuters press card over Gaza

Submitted by Mohamed Hashem on Mon, 09/08/2025 - 20:25
“One voice message I got from a journalist in Gaza… that’s worth more to me than anything I did with Reuters.”

For eight years, Valerie Zink worked as a photojournalist for Reuters. But after Israel killed her colleagues in Gaza, and western media coverage led to accusations of complicity in Israel’s genocide, she could no longer stay silent.

Valerie publicly resigned and cut up her Reuters press card, speaking out against the double standards in western media’s treatment of Palestinian journalists. She shares the breaking point she reached after reading Al Jazeera journalist Anas al-Sharif’s final words, the silence she faced from Canadian outlets for supporting Palestine, and what her time in Gaza taught her years ago, a journey that she says still fuels her rage today.

title: Israel destroys Peace Tower in Gaza City
summary:
Israel destroys Peace Tower in Gaza City

Israel is destroying swaths of residential buildings in Gaza City, according to Arabic media reports. 

An Israeli air strike destroyed the Peace Tower in the centre of Gaza City on Monday, Al Jazeera Arabic reported. 

In recent days, a video has emerged of Israel destroying huge apartment towers while Palestinians in Gaza scramble for shelter in makeshift tents.
